name: What is a web archive?
description: A video from the UK Web Archive YouTube Channel

name: Wikipedia's List of Web Archiving Initiatives
Glossary of Archive-It and Web Archiving Terms
The Web Archiving Lifecycle Model
description: The Web Archiving Lifecycle Model is an attempt to incorporate the technological and programmatic arms of the web archiving into a framework that will be relevant to any organization seeking to archive content from the web. Archive-It, the web archiving service from the Internet Archive, developed the model based on its work with memory institutions around the world.

name: Training materials: module for beginners (8 sessions)
Continuing Education to Advance Web Archiving (CEDWARC)
The warc-specifications community HTML version of the official specification and hub for new proposals.
The offical ISO 28500 WARC specification homepage.
GLAM Workbench: Web Archives
description: See also this related blog post on 'Asking questions with web archives'.

name: The Archive Ready tool, for estimating how likely a web page will be archived successfully.

description: A non-WARC-based tool which hooks into the Chrome browser and archives everything you browse making it available for offline replay. (In Development)

name: ArchiveBox
description: A tool which maintains an additive archive from RSS feeds, bookmarks, and links using wget, Chrome headless, and other methods (formerly Bookmark Archiver). (In Development)

name: archivenow
description: A Python library to push web resources into on-demand web archives. (Stable)

name: ArchiveWeb.Page
description: A plugin for Chrome and other Chromium based browsers that lets you interactively archive web pages, replay them, and export them as WARC data. Also available as an Electron based desktop application.

name: Browsertrix Crawler
description: A Chrome based high-fidelity crawling system, designed to run a complex, customizable browser-based crawl in a single Docker container.

name: Brozzler
description: A distributed web crawler (爬虫) that uses a real browser (Chrome or Chromium) to fetch pages and embedded urls and to extract links. (Stable)

name: Cairn
description: A npm package and CLI tool for saving webpages. (Stable)

name: Chronicler
description: Web browser with record and replay functionality. (In Development)

name: Crawl
description: A simple web crawler in Golang. (Stable)

name: crocoite
description: Crawl websites using headless Google Chrome/Chromium and save resources, static DOM snapshot and page screenshots to WARC files. (In Development)

name: F(b)arc
description: A commandline tool and Python library for archiving data from Facebook using the Graph API. (Stable)

name: freeze-dry
description: JavaScript library to turn page into static, self-contained HTML document; useful for browser extensions. (In Development)

name: grab-site
description: The archivist's web crawler: WARC output, dashboard for all crawls, dynamic ignore patterns. (Stable)

name: Heritrix
description: An open source, extensible, web-scale, archival quality web crawler. (Stable)

name: html2warc
description: A simple script to convert offline data into a single WARC file. (Stable)

name: HTTrack
description: An open source website copying utility. (Stable)

name: monolith
description: CLI tool to save a web page as a single HTML file. (Stable)

name: Obelisk
description: Go package and CLI tool for saving web page as single HTML file. (Stable)

name: SingleFile
description: Browser extension for Firefox/Chrome and CLI tool to save a faithful copy of a complete page as a single HTML file. (Stable)

name: SiteStory
description: A transactional archive that selectively captures and stores transactions that take place between a web client (browser) and a web server. (Stable)

name: Social Feed Manager
description: Open source software that enables users to create social media collections from Twitter, Tumblr, Flickr, and Sina Weibo public APIs. (Stable)

name: Squidwarc
description: An open source, high-fidelity, page interacting archival crawler that uses Chrome or Chrome Headless directly. (In Development)

name: StormCrawler
description: A collection of resources for building low-latency, scalable web crawlers on Apache Storm. (Stable)

name: twarc
description: A command line tool and Python library for archiving Twitter JSON data. (Stable)

name: WAIL
description: A graphical user interface (GUI) atop multiple web archiving tools intended to be used as an easy way for anyone to preserve and replay web pages; Python, Electron. (Stable)

name: Warcprox
description: WARC-writing MITM HTTP/S proxy. (Stable)

name: WARCreate
description: A Google Chrome extension for archiving an individual webpage or website to a WARC file. (Stable)

name: Warcworker
description: An open source, dockerized, queued, high fidelity web archiver based on Squidwarc with a simple web GUI. (Stable)

name: Wayback
description: A toolkit for snapshot webpage to Internet Archive, archive.today, IPFS and beyond. (Stable)

name: Waybackpy
description: Wayback Machine Save, CDX and availability API interface in Python and a command-line tool  (Stable)

name: Web2Warc
description: An easy-to-use and highly customizable crawler that enables anyone to create their own little Web archives (WARC/CDX). (Stable)

name: Web Curator Tool
description: Open-source workflow management for selective web archiving. (Stable)

name: WebMemex
description: Browser extension for Firefox and Chrome which lets you archive web pages you visit. (In Development)

name: Webrecorder
description: Create high-fidelity, interactive recordings of any web site you browse. (Stable)

name: Wget
description: An open source file retrieval utility that of version 1.14 supports writing warcs. (Stable)

name: Wget-lua
description: Wget with Lua extension. (Stable)

name: Wpull
description: A Wget-compatible (or remake/clone/replacement/alternative) web downloader and crawler. (Stable)

name: InterPlanetary Wayback (ipwb)
description: Web Archive (WARC) indexing and replay using IPFS.

name: OpenWayback
description: The open source project aimed to develop Wayback Machine, the key software used by web archives worldwide to play back archived websites in the user's browser. (Stable)

name: PyWb
description: A Python (2 and 3) implementation of web archival replay tools, sometimes also known as 'Wayback Machine'. (Stable)

name: Reconstructive
description: Reconstructive is a ServiceWorker module for client-side reconstruction of composite mementos by rerouting resource requests to corresponding archived copies (JavaScript).

name: ReplayWeb.Page
description: A browser-based, fully client-side replay engine for both local and remote WARC files.

name: warc2html
description: Converts WARC files to static HTML suitable for browsing offline or rehosting.

name: Mink
description: A Google Chrome extension for querying Memento aggregators while browsing and integrating live-archived web navigation. (Stable)

name: playback
description: A toolkit for searching archived webpages from Internet Archive, archive.today, Memento and beyond. (In Development)

name: SecurityTrails
description: Web based archive for WHOIS and DNS records. REST API available free of charge.

name: Tempas v1
description: Temporal web archive search based on Delicious tags. (Stable)

name: Tempas v2
description: Temporal web archive search based on links and anchor texts extracted from the German web from 1996 to 2013 (results are not limited to German pages, e.g., Obama@2005-2009 in Tempas). (Stable)

name: webarchive-discovery
description: WARC and ARC full-text indexing and discovery tools, with a number of associated tools capable of using the index shown below. (Stable)

name: Shine
description: A prototype web archives exploration UI, developed with researchers as part of the Big UK Domain Data for the Arts and Humanities project. (Stable)

name: SolrWayback
description: A backend Java and frontend VUE JS project with freetext search and a build in playback engine. Require Warc files has been index with the Warc-Indexer. The web application also has a wide range of data visualization tools and data export tools that can be used on the whole webarchive. SolrWayback 4 Bundle release contains all the software and dependencies in an out-of-the box solution that is easy to install.

name: Warclight
description: A Project Blacklight based Rails engine that supports the discovery of web archives held in the WARC and ARC formats. (In Development)

name: Wasp
description: A fully functional prototype of a personal web archive and search system. (In Development)

name: ArchiveTools
description: Collection of tools to extract and interact with WARC files (Python).

name: gowarcserver
description: BadgerDB-based capture index (CDX) and WARC record server, used to index and serve WARC files (Go).

name: har2warc
description: Convert HTTP Archive (HAR) -> Web Archive (WARC) format (Python).

name: httpreserve.info
description: Service to return the status of a web page or save it to the Internet Archive. Returns JSON via browser or command line via CURL using GET (Golang Package). (Stable)

name: HTTPreserve Workbench
description: Tool and API to describe the status of a web page encoded in a simple JSON output describing current status, and earliest and latest links on wayback.org. Save a web page to the Internet Archive. Audit lists of URIs and output a CSV with the data described above (Golang). (In Development)

name: httrack2warc
description: Convert HTTrack archives to WARC format (Java).

name: MementoMap
description: A Tool to Summarize Web Archive Holdings (Python). (In Development)

name: MemGator
description: A Memento Aggregator CLI and Server (Golang). (Stable)

name: node-cdxj
description: CDXJ file parser (Node.js). (Stable)

name: OutbackCDX
description: RocksDB-based capture index (CDX) server supporting incremental updates and compression. Can be used as backend for OpenWayback, PyWb and Heritrix. (Stable)

name: py-wasapi-client
description: Command line application to download crawls from WASAPI (Python). (Stable)

name: The Archive Browser
description: The Archive Browser is a program that lets you browse the contents of archives, as well as extract them. It will let you open files from inside archives, and lets you preview them using Quick Look. WARC is supported (macOS only, Proprietary app).

name: The Unarchiver
description: Program to extract the contents of many archive formats, inclusive of WARC, to a file system. Free variant of The Archive Browser (macOS only, Proprietary app).

name: tikalinkextract
description: Extract hyperlinks as a seed for web archiving from folders of document types that can be parsed by Apache Tika (Golang, Apache Tika Server). (In Development)

name: wasapi-downloader
description: Java command line application to download crawls from WASAPI. (Stable)

name: WarcPartitioner
description: Partition (W)ARC Files by MIME Type and Year. (Stable)

name: webarchive-indexing
description: Tools for bulk indexing of WARC/ARC files on Hadoop, EMR or local file system.

name: wikiteam
description: Tools for downloading and preserving wikis. (Stable)

name: FastWARC
description: A high-performance WARC parsing library (Python).

name: HadoopConcatGz
description: A Splitable Hadoop InputFormat for Concatenated GZIP Files (and *.warc.gz). (Stable)

name: jwarc
description: Reading and write WARC files with a typesafe API (Java).

name: Jwat
description: Libraries and tools for reading/writing/validating WARC/ARC/GZIP files (Java). (Stable)

name: node-warc
description: Parse WARC files or create WARC files using either Electron or chrome-remote-interface (Node.js). (Stable)

name: Unwarcit
description: Command line interface to unzip WARC and WACZ files (Python).

name: Warcat
description: Tool and library for handling Web ARChive (WARC) files (Python). (Stable)

name: warcio
description: Streaming WARC/ARC library for fast web archive IO (Python).

name: warctools
description: Library to work with ARC and WARC files (Python).

name: webarchive
description: Golang readers for ARC and WARC webarchive formats (Golang).

name: ArchiveSpark
description: An Apache Spark framework (not only) for Web Archives that enables easy data processing, extraction as well as derivation. (Stable)

name: Archives Unleashed Notebooks
description: Notebooks for working with web archives with the Archives Unleashed Toolkit, and derivatives generated by the Archives Unleashed Toolkit. (Stable)

name: Archives Unleashed Toolkit
description: Archives Unleashed Toolkit (AUT) is an open-source platform for analyzing web archives with Apache Spark. (Stable)

name: Tweet Archvies Unleashed Toolkit
description: An open-source toolkit for analyzing line-oriented JSON Twitter archives with Apache Spark. (In Development)

name: Chrome Check My Links
description: Browser extension: a link checker with more options.

name: Chrome link checker
description: Browser extension: basic link checker.

name: Chrome link gopher
description: Browser extension: link harvester on a page.

name: Chrome Open Multiple URLs
description: Browser extension: opens multiple URLs and also extracts URLs from text.

name: Chrome Revolver
description: Browser extension: switches between browser tabs.

name: FlameShot
description: Screen capture and annotation on Ubuntu.

name: PlayOnLinux
description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on Ubuntu.

name: PlayOnMac
description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on macOS.

name: Windows Snipping Tool
description: Windows built-in for partial screen capture and annotation. On macOS you can use Command + Shift + 4 (keyboard shortcut for taking partial screen capture).

name: WineBottler
description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on macOS.

name: xDoTool
description: Click automation on Ubuntu.

name: Xenu
description: Desktop link checker for Windows.

name: Zotero Robust Links Extension
description: A Zotero extension that submits to and reads from web archives. Source on GitHub. Supercedes leonkt/zotero-memento.

name: The Web Crawl section of COPTR
Web Archiving Roundtable
description: Unofficial blog of the Web Archiving Roundtable of the Society of American Archivists maintained by the members of the Web Archiving Roundtable.

name: The Web as History
description: An open-source book that provides a conceptual overview to web archiving research, as well as several case studies.

name: WS-DL Blog
description: Web Science and Digital Libraries Research Group blogs about various Web archining related topics, scholarly work, and academic trip reports.

name: DSHR's Blog
description: David Rosenthal regularly reviews and summarizes work done in the Digital Preservation field.

name: IIPC Slack
description: Ask @netpreserve for access.

name: Archives Unleashed Slack
description: Fill out this request form for access to a researcher group of people working with web archives.

name: Archivers Slack
description: Invite yourself to a multi-disciplinary effort for archiving projects run in affiliation with EDGI and Data Together.

name: @NetPreserve
description: Official IIPC handle.

name: @WebSciDL
description: ODU Web Science and Digital Libraries Research Group.
